title: Time4jail — Intensify post-login splash messages and rotate generated mugshot fallback visuals

requirements.summary: Refresh the post-login splash message pool to be more intense/assertive while staying non-profane and focused on safety, boundaries, documentation, and legal accountability.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/utils/postLoginSplashMessages.ts is updated with a refreshed set of messages that feel noticeably more intense/assertive than the current list but avoid slurs, profanity, doxxing, or threats of illegal violence
Messages remain short splash-friendly lines (generally 1–2 sentences) and are written in English
The post-login splash continues to display a randomly selected message on each splash view

file_operations.description: Replace the fixed POST_LOGIN_SPLASH_MESSAGES list with a refreshed, "extra extra spicy" (intense/assertive) set that remains non-profane, non-defamatory, and focused on safety planning, boundaries, documentation, and legal accountability; keep getRandomSplashMessage behavior intact to preserve random selection each splash view.

requirements.summary: Swap the post-login splash static fallback image for a randomized set of generated generic mugshot-style images when no motivational video is available or the video fails.
acceptanceCriteria: Add a small set of new generated mugshot-style images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them as the splash fallback instead of the single hard-coded /assets/5425a899ef3d6.image.jpg reference
When no motivational video is available (or video fails), PostLoginSplash shows one randomly selected mugshot-style image from the generated set
When a motivational video is available and loads successfully, PostLoginSplash behavior remains unchanged (video still displays), and the motivation message still displays as it does today
